<a id="int"></a>

# int

A built-in type for integers.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Signed 64-bit integer type. This means that it can take values from ``-2^63`` to ``2^63 - 1``, i.e. from ``-9223372036854775808`` to ``9223372036854775807``. When it exceeds these bounds, it will wrap around.

\ **int**\\ s can be automatically converted to [float](float.md)\\ s when necessary, for example when passing them as arguments in functions. The [float](float.md) will be as close to the original integer as possible.

Likewise, [float](float.md)\\ s can be automatically converted into **int**\\ s. This will truncate the [float](float.md), discarding anything after the floating-point.

\ **Note:** In a boolean context, an **int** will evaluate to ``false`` if it equals ``0``, and to ``true`` otherwise.




```gdscript
    var x: int = 1 # x is 1
    x = 4.2 # x is 4, because 4.2 gets truncated
    var max_int = 9223372036854775807 # Biggest value an int can store
    max_int += 1 # max_int is -9223372036854775808, because it wrapped around
```


```csharp
    int x = 1; // x is 1
    x = (int)4.2; // x is 4, because 4.2 gets truncated
    // We use long below, because GDScript's int is 64-bit while C#'s int is 32-bit.
    long maxLong = 9223372036854775807; // Biggest value a long can store
    maxLong++; // maxLong is now -9223372036854775808, because it wrapped around.

    // Alternatively with C#'s 32-bit int type, which has a smaller maximum value.
    int maxInt = 2147483647; // Biggest value an int can store
    maxInt++; // maxInt is now -2147483648, because it wrapped around
```




You can use the ``0b`` literal for binary representation, the ``0x`` literal for hexadecimal representation, and the ``_`` symbol to separate long numbers and improve readability.




```gdscript
    var x = 0b1001 # x is 9
    var y = 0xF5 # y is 245
    var z = 10_000_000 # z is 10000000
```


```csharp
    int x = 0b1001; // x is 9
    int y = 0xF5; // y is 245
    int z = 10_000_000; // z is 10000000
```

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constructor Descriptions

<a id="int_constructor_int"></a>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[int](int.md) **int**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_constructor_int)

Constructs an **int** set to ``0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[int](int.md) **int**\ (\ from\: [int](int.md)\ )

Constructs an **int** as a copy of the given **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[int](int.md) **int**\ (\ from\: [String](String.md)\ )

Constructs a new **int** from a [String](String.md), following the same rules as [String.to_int()](String.md#String_method_to_int).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[int](int.md) **int**\ (\ from\: [bool](bool.md)\ )

Constructs a new **int** from a [bool](bool.md). ``true`` is converted to ``1`` and ``false`` is converted to ``0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[int](int.md) **int**\ (\ from\: [float](float.md)\ )

Constructs a new **int** from a [float](float.md). This will truncate the [float](float.md), discarding anything after the floating point.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Operator Descriptions

<a id="int_operator_neq_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator !=**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_neq_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is not equivalent to the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_neq_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator !=**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_neq_int)

Returns ``true`` if the **int**\\ s are not equal.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mod_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator %**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mod_int)

Returns the remainder after dividing two **int**\\ s. Uses truncated division, which returns a negative number if the dividend is negative. If this is not desired, consider using [@GlobalScope.posmod()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_posmod).

```
    print(6 % 2) # Prints 0
    print(11 % 4) # Prints 3
    print(-5 % 3) # Prints -2
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwand_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator &**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwand_int)

Performs the bitwise ``AND`` operation.

```
    print(0b1100 & 0b1010) # Prints 8 (binary 1000)
```


This is useful for retrieving binary flags from a variable.

```
    var flags = 0b101
    # Check if the first or second bit are enabled.
    if flags & 0b011:
        do_stuff() # This line will run.
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Color)

Multiplies each component of the [Color](Color.md) by the **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Quaternion"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Quaternion](Quaternion.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Quaternion](Quaternion.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Quaternion)

Multiplies each component of the [Quaternion](Quaternion.md) by the **int**. This operation is not meaningful on its own, but it can be used as a part of a larger expression.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Vector2"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Vector2)

Multiplies each component of the [Vector2](Vector2.md) by the **int**.

```
    print(2 * Vector2(1, 4)) # Prints (2, 8)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Vector2i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Vector2i)

Multiplies each component of the [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) by the **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Vector3"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Vector3](Vector3.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Vector3)

Multiplies each component of the [Vector3](Vector3.md) by the **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_Vector3i"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Vector3i](Vector3i.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Vector3i](Vector3i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_Vector3i)

Multiplies each component of the [Vector3i](Vector3i.md) by the **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_float)

Multiplies the [float](float.md) by the **int**. The result is a [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_mul_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_mul_int)

Multiplies the two **int**\\ s.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_pow_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator ****\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_pow_float)

Raises an **int** to a power of a [float](float.md). The result is a [float](float.md).

```
    print(2 ** 0.5) # Prints 1.4142135623731
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_pow_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator ****\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_pow_int)

Raises the left **int** to a power of the right **int**.

```
    print(3 ** 4) # Prints 81
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_sum_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator +**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_sum_float)

Adds the **int** and the [float](float.md). The result is a [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_sum_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator +**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_sum_int)

Adds the two **int**\\ s.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_dif_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator -**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_dif_float)

Subtracts the [float](float.md) from the **int**. The result is a [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_dif_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator -**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_dif_int)

Subtracts the two **int**\\ s.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_div_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_div_float)

Divides the **int** by the [float](float.md). The result is a [float](float.md).

```
    print(10 / 3.0) # Prints 3.33333333333333
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_div_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_div_int)

Divides the two **int**\\ s. The result is an **int**. This will truncate the [float](float.md), discarding anything after the floating point.

```
    print(6 / 2) # Prints 3
    print(5 / 3) # Prints 1
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_lt_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_lt_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is less than the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_lt_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_lt_int)

Returns ``true`` if the left **int** is less than the right **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwsl_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator &lt;&lt;**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwsl_int)

Performs the bitwise shift left operation. Effectively the same as multiplying by a power of 2.

```
    print(0b1010 &lt;&lt; 1) # Prints 20 (binary 10100)
    print(0b1010 &lt;&lt; 3) # Prints 80 (binary 1010000)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_lte_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;=**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_lte_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is less than or equal to the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_lte_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &lt;=**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_lte_int)

Returns ``true`` if the left **int** is less than or equal to the right **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_eq_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator ==**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_eq_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is equal to the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_eq_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator ==**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_eq_int)

Returns ``true`` if the two **int**\\ s are equal.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_gt_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_gt_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is greater than the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_gt_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_gt_int)

Returns ``true`` if the left **int** is greater than the right **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_gte_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;=**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_gte_float)

Returns ``true`` if the **int** is greater than or equal to the [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_gte_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator &gt;=**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_gte_int)

Returns ``true`` if the left **int** is greater than or equal to the right **int**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwsr_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator &gt;&gt;**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwsr_int)

Performs the bitwise shift right operation. Effectively the same as dividing by a power of 2.

```
    print(0b1010 &gt;&gt; 1) # Prints 5 (binary 101)
    print(0b1010 &gt;&gt; 2) # Prints 2 (binary 10)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwxor_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator ^**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwxor_int)

Performs the bitwise ``XOR`` operation.

```
    print(0b1100 ^ 0b1010) # Prints 6 (binary 110)
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_unplus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator unary+**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_unplus)

Returns the same value as if the ``+`` was not there. Unary ``+`` does nothing, but sometimes it can make your code more readable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_unminus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator unary-**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_unminus)

Returns the negated value of the **int**. If positive, turns the number negative. If negative, turns the number positive. If zero, does nothing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwor_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator |**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwor_int)

Performs the bitwise ``OR`` operation.

```
    print(0b1100 | 0b1010) # Prints 14 (binary 1110)
```


This is useful for storing binary flags in a variable.

```
    var flags = 0
    flags |= 0b101 # Turn the first and third bits on.
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="int_operator_bwnot"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[int](int.md) **operator ~**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#int_operator_bwnot)

Performs the bitwise ``NOT`` operation on the **int**. Due to [2's complement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement), it's effectively equal to ``-(int + 1)``.

```
    print(~4) # Prints -5
    print(~(-7)) # Prints 6
```
